Key Match Events: India defeated Sri Lanka by 43 runs in the first T20I of the three-match series in Pallekele.
Riyan Parag took three wickets off just eight deliveries.
Axar Patel and Arshdeep Singh grabbed a brace of wickets each.
Matheesha Pathirana took 4 wickets for 40 runs.
Pathum Nissanka scored a half-century for Sri Lanka.
Axar Patel dismissed Pathum Nissanka and Kusal Perera in the same over.
Riyan Parag bowled the last two batters on consecutive deliveries in the 20th over.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka won the toss and opted to field.
The pitch was expected to be high-scoring but might get slower as the ball loses its hardness.
The wind was blowing and the atmosphere was cool and pleasant.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka captain Charith Asalanka expressed disappointment with the middle-order batting and mentioned the need for future experiments.
India captain Suryakumar Yadav credited Sri Lanka for playing a good brand of cricket and mentioned the importance of the left-right combination for the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India set a target of 214 runs for Sri Lanka.
Sri Lanka were restricted to 170 all out in 19.2 overs.
